You should set the datetime format in report parameter dialog first, otherwise ReportDate you appended in URL can't be parsed and no data set found.
The problem is that on local machine it works but when I try to access on external DB, that is the exact copy of the one on my machine, it doesn?t work.

I tried to change, as you suggested me, the datetime format but in this case I get the following message:

The value "2007-01-14" is invalid with the type "dateTime".

It works only if I leave it as "String", but I'm not sure I'm changing the right option: I changed it from "Outline" window -> Report Parameters -> double click on "ReportDate" parameter -> DataType setted to DateTime.

It is correct? If yes it doesn't work.

(In reply to comment #4)
> You should set the datetime format in report parameter dialog first, otherwise
> ReportDate you appended in URL can't be parsed and no data set found.

I just looked at the first chart and corresponding data set "GRA_weight" in your report design file, and find following issues that may cause exception:
1. In data set "GRA_weight", Data type of parameter "param2" should be Date rather than String, and this parameter should link to report parameter "ReportDate".
2. In report parameter "ReportDate", Data type should be Date, and format should be like "yyyy-MM-dd", if you want to append "2007-06-11".
I previewed a chart that binds the dataset (remote db) with parameter, it works in that way.
